list_definition.definition: to eat or wear away (metals etc); to destroy gradually

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The individual’s right to privacy is being eroded.

list_ex_of_english: As the state intruded into white agriculture, paternalism could also be challenged, eroded and remade.
As would be expected, the logarithmic layer is eroded, and ultimately vanishes, as the stress gradient increases in importance.
In the whole southern realm, social status was eroded by commercial activity.
The resulting delays and confusion eroded any military successes and gave the enemy time to recover.
The back sur face of the sculpture is highly eroded, but one can see on that side the rendering of the arms.
The lord wears an elaborate hip- and loincloth, which is also eroded.
Second, large integrative interest groups with close links to political parties are rapidly eroding.
Through this work, some previous discursive strategies for containing trauma are eroding.
